text: Sup, you beautiful bastards, hope you're havin' a fantastic friday
Welcome back to the Friday show
and for those of you that are new here, Monday Tuesday, Wednesday Thursday I like to talk about the news.
world events, and then Friday it's all about the conversation. Friday's
where I look back to the last week, of your responses to the videos, your comments
And then I comment back, but before we jump into that, I've been asked
by a ton of people. To respond to something.
Let's just knock this out of the way. Over the past few months we've talked about an individual by the name of
Tariq Nasheed several times.
and a lot of the time it seems to be him calling people suspected white supremacist
because they don't agree with him. One of the claims
over the past few months was going after Bill Cosby for all those rapes was racist
calling Cosby's black female accusers 'tokens'
And in response for me covering these stories, calling him out, he has called me a suspected white supremacist
and then this week he appears he created a website,
a database, called the SWS database
and it is essentially a list of 'suspected white supremacists'
And guess who(definitely not him) put on that site?
Me, Philip de Franco, reasoning: apparently trolling
Priority: Medium
So a lot of people started sending this to me because we just talked about Tariq
This almost seemed like a response or coverage
of he and DeRay getting angry at the Planet of the Apes movie
Saying the movie was 'racist' and two things stuck out to me about this
One: it is incredibly concerning that someone would make a list like this
because it looks like someone is trying to get someone else killed
and if not killed, just trying to ruin someone by association.
Race-baiting, stuff like this, this is the stuff that gets people hurt
Now I understand, because I have looked into Tariq Nasheed's background
That he is just playing an angle, he is trying to get money and gain fame
anyway possible. This is just his most recent avenue,
In the past Tariq used to go by 'K-Flex', which stood for 'King Flex'
He had a hit song called 'Wash Yo Ass', he also wrote the books 'The Mack within',
'The Elite Way', 'The Art of Mackin' ' a book that reportedly tells men
"what to say word for word, in order to get sex from women, guaranteed"
He also wrote books for women like ' The Art of Gold Digging'
I am just mentioning his past here because he tried to use mine
to negate what I am saying now
because after people realise that Tariq was trying to push this website
and they started making fun of him, that their logo, the logo looks like a Nazi swastika
For someone that sees racism everywhere, I don't know how he missed that
then after all that he pushes out this clip from me, I think like 9 years ago
And if you have watched me the past few years
I acknowledge how much of a stupid douchebag I was back then
I thought I was so edgy and so funny
Just saying anything I thought would get a reaction
and also, urg, the delivery makes it even worse
when he posted this clip of me 9 years ago
trying to make a joke about how black people talk during movies
and then he includes my horrible attempt at a anti-racism joke
And I say something like 'I am essentially a black guy because I like watermelon'
And it is so fucking cringy and there are people sharing it
like 'Oh! Phil! this video leaked!', like what do you mean it leaked? It's on my channel
once again, for the people that are new here,I do not run away from my stupid shitty past
an actual comedian could have gotten those jokes work
but my delivery is so horrible, it sounds like I actually believe the stupid bullshit thats coming out of my mouth
and Tariq, and its probably an accident, excludes the context of this shitty joke
the description reads:
(And I don't even remember writing this because it was so many years ago)
In advance to all the OMG YOU'RE A RACIST COMMENTS...
it's less of me being racist and more having fun with blanket stereotypes
for him to exclude that and use this as evidence for me being a white supremacist
its purposefully misleading, right there I express this is my attempt to make fun of
blanket stereotypes, they are stupid, they are incorrect
that version of me, about a decade ago sucked, I was a no talent douchebag
and I keep those old videos up, despite the fact that people periodically
try to use my past against me when they realise they don't really have an argument
and I do that because if you compare and contrast who I am now,
to who I was then, I think it shows people you can evolve, you can grow
I would slap the stupid off the face of 10 years ago Philip DeFranco
My stupid, stupid past doesn't change the fact
that Tariq Nasheed is trying to profit off of race-baiting.
it doesn't change the fact he is making a list
and database of people who oppose his race- baiting
helping to create a dangerous and volatile environment
It doesn't change the fact that Tariq goes after black people who don't agree with him
and calls then 'tokens' and 'coons'
even when those people are rape victims and rape survivors
we can just go on and on with the horrible bullshit he pulls but
thats where we are going to end that. From that, lets jump into the Monday show
On Monday we had the China-censorship crack down,
The cop who shot 2 dogs, the death at the Mad Cool festival,
Lele Ponz fake donation accusation,
the British MP's racist comment
and President trump, Ivanka Trump and Donald Trump Jr. stories
regarding the death at Mad Cool festival, Clockmouse wrote:
'if Pedro was aa true performer, which I'm absolutely sure he was, he would have wanted the show to go on'
well, do we know that for sure? I think you might be projecting
your personal feelings of what you would want in that situation
or your thoughts of a true showman what they would do
I don't personally know Pedro, maybe what you are saying is 100% true
maybe he would have just wanted everyone to like hold off a minute
But I would prefer, if I died nothing else interesting happen for 24 hours
so that shit has to be news
like if I die in a plane crash, there better fucking not be an actual celebrity on that plane
I need my name trending on twitter for at least 10 hours
I need, I need people that like barely watched me 7 years ago
to go like 'man, he was a real influence on my life'
and preferably they attach a picture on that post, not even of me
but of them looking sad
you know, so they can make it about themselves.
Regarding China's censorship, Isabella Mia wrote:
I hate all these ignorant comments. Incest, sexual abuse, pedophilia, etc.
will never be like homosexuality because homosexuality doesn't damage someone's life.
If two people of the same gender loving one another is so terrible to you
then mind your own business. There's clearly a difference  SO IT'S NOT IN THE SAME CATEGORY.
That's why people are shocked by what China us doing'
Yes, I agree with you here, I will never fully understand it
The fact that China bared homosexuality and put it on the same list as sexual assault and pedophilia
Thats insane, but I always try to figure out where someone is coming from
and based off of the comments I saw on the video
of people saying 'no, China should or can do this',
it always seemed to come down to one or two reasons for them
and that was either religion based or what they said was values based
W/L wrote: ' I totally understand where China is coming from. They care about their values as a nation,
where heterosexual family is highly prioritised.
Unless they are physically hurting and slaughtering all the gay people, there is nothing wrong with it.
Gay people can move out of the country if they want to or live there
China is just an entity that chose not to promote same sex relationships
Is that wrong? The US chose to give people guns and let them speak their minds.
Is that wrong? Different countries, different views on the world.
You have no right to tell anyone how to live their lives
China does not tell people to stop being gay or that you cannot be one
it just does not promote homosexuality within its 1.4 billion people country.
That is all to it,' So the first thing I will say here is
Your argument of what countries allow is a little flawed
You say the US let people have guns, let them speak their minds
and you made the comparison to what China does not allow, the take away, a negative
that doesn't help your argument, that feeds my argument
and as far as 'different cultures different rules', I get where you are coming from
but there are countries where women are seen as second class citizens, they are not allowed to drive,
places where you can beat your wife and my response is:
'well different cultures', no, I say 'fuck you' to the people that think that is ok
imaginary lines in the sand shouldn't change what human rights should be, in my eyes
and the fact that your line of physically hurting or slaughtering,
that would be where the line is crossed, that is insane
the road that leads to the slaughter, that leads to the violence
that is the path paved with the pushing out of a minority
the normalisation of human beings were born a certain way, who interact
with another in a consensual manner and the argument that they are promoting
being gay, are you worried that you are going to catch 'it'?
How do you think being gay works? Do you think it is like cigarettes?
You are going to see it on TV and your like 'oh my god,
I should try that, and now I an addicted! Not even once!'
If you think that is a possibility, you need to take a long
look in the mirror and figure out who you are on the inside
its the same thing for people saying 'being gay is a choice'
if you think its a choice, you need to take a break from speaking publicly
and within why you think that, once agin, thats my opinion
I feel like your argument is flawed but we are who we are
Now lets talk about the Tuesday show
Tuesday we had DeRay going after Planet of the Apes, G20 protests
and Donald Trump Jr. emails and meetings.
On the G20 protests, Lily Bohan wrote:
I don't understand why people think it is bad to punch a nazis??
Like if people like Richard Spencer advocate violence against minorities, why can't we fight back?
Its the American thing to do. All the veterans that right wingers talk so fondly about punched nazis.
And don't give me freedom of speak crap, y'all love freedom of speech
until it's in the form of left wing protest
and not some racist troll preaching backwards ideology
and so Lily I am imagining you mention Richard Spencer specifically
because of course he was punched at that protest
in fact he has been punched multiple times and Lily the reason why I personally have a problem
with the statement of 'punch a nazi!' because it feels like more and more people are moving the goal post
as far as what a nazi is, that idea that it is ok
to physically assault someone because of something they said
that that is ok, thats what leads to $100,000 plus
of damage being done to Burkley because people don't want Milo Yiannopoulos to speak
And do you know what all that damage did? It just made Milo more popular
and it made all the people that stood against him look like crazy violent people
and do you know what did the most damage to Milo Yiannopoulos?
Him being allowed to open him mouth, to say something that so many people
found disgusting, that it hurt him.
I mention Milo here not because I am saying he is a Nazi but people have called him a Nazi
and also because there are people that see Milo and Spencer as one and the same
Meanwhile if you look at Richard Spencers tweets, it looks like he hates Milo
and now just think about these people with their own words
rather than violence against them, you have the same example with Richard Spencer
when Richard Spencer got attacked at a protest, all it did was make moderates go
'hey, thats not right', when Richard Spencer was allowed to speak
he spoke to that ballroom full of people and people started doing the Nazi salute
a lot of people just end up damaging themselves with there own argument
I, personally, dislike Spence, I find a lot of what he does and how he does it
to be disgusting and I am not going to further my cause,
my argument, my point of view to the world
by cheering on the assault of another person because of what they said
Let's talk about Wednesday, Wednesday we talked about net neutrality
and everyone taking another stand, and the controversy and outrage
around a viral video involving a 14 year old girl and winco loss prevention
regarding net neutrality, Lancealot35 wrote:
'When choosing free markets vs government intervention I will always go with the free market.
The reason we have these crappy monopolies with the IPSs
is due to the government favors and regulations so of course
all the big companies will be for net neutrality.
take regulations out and allow more competition which favours the people'
And so Lance, I can understand your argument it is a hard thing for me to say
'Yes, Government Intervention!'
especially if you see the government like me, often this big,
dumb, slow, fuck up. Often fat, dumb and slow.
but unfortunately our government is not handling the thing that is not allowing
the free market to do what the free market should be able to do
so why instead pull away the thing that does protect the big companies, protects the new companies,
protects the people? If the big highest people think they can get away with it,
there is nothing to stop them. And add on to that,
I do, personally, believe that the internet is such a big part of our lives
it should be considered a utility; so because of all that
I don't want this repeal and I think that the government intervention
is necessary. The repeal is just going to enable a predator- prey relationship
Kaister901 wrote: ' Holy shit... the comments...
I was looking for people to be like, "Shit! We need to protect our internet!"
and then you see people arguing about a stealing candy... Wtf people?
Like do you not have a sense of priority? Your pornhub will be fucking slow...
How is that less significant than a stolen candy drama?...'
Think of the porn, damn it!
you won't even be able to get on to get off. Then around that candy story,
Ty G wrote: 'I'm a strong believer in the fact that resisting= consequences
That being said, sometimes it goes too far and the police or security  can end up
being the assholes in the situation. Either way it still started for one reason,
you broke the law! Don't do that and rest assured that you will be safe and sound
Just an Art Parasite wrote:
Shoplifting is wrong and people should be punished but this is going way too far.
The worst punishment for shoplifting is usually community service or something,
there's no way something as small as candy should NOT have a violent response like this.'
I am imagining saying it should not have a violent response like this
well to that just end , I think you need to think of the order of how everything went down
from all the reports, it doesn't seem she stole the candy bar
and they just threw her ass to the ground and dragged her around
once again, it appears she was caught and questioned, she then tried to run away
and physically attacked an employee and then after that alleged assault, los prevention tried to detain her
this situation stopped being about a candy bar the moment she went physical
that being said, there were people in the comments that raised, I think,  a valid debate
is the charge, is the penalty too much?
Is goal to actually have her learn from this or is it punish her?
Especially because in the united states, the recidivism rate is insanely high
especially for felons
Being a felon often puts them in a hole that is hard to scrap out of legitimately.
Then finally, lets talk about Thursday. Thursday we talked about the several Rocks that may be running for office,
the 'what the hell happened to Sammy Sosa controversy' and the case of mistaken identity with Tatiana
First up, in my response to what celebrity would you actually vote for President
Callum wrote: Boaty McBoatface for president, no explanation needed
Frosty: Morgan Freeman because every speech would be golden
Elisea Pena: I would elect Kevin Spacey because that would make him the worlds greatest method actor
Vance Baylis wrote: Kanye, because everyone loves Kanye, especially Kanye
Waffles wrote: Guy Fieri, because if we're gonna have a meme president,
I want it at least to be the guy in charge of what ever the hell 'Flavourtown' is
Waffles wins, sorry everyone else that submitted
He didn't have me with the choice but he won me over with the explanation
On the jet blast deck Crazelord91 wrote:
Anyone else get the feeling that personal responsibility just doesn't exist anymore?
The girl from yesterday who attacked staff and people wanting her to get off the hook,
this girl today with the plane, and even just cops in general. Feels like it's always someone else's "mistake",
because no one can ever be wrong or at fault anymore in modern America
Craze, thats an interesting point that you make,
I often wonder, where does personal responsibility begin and end?
We can't hold people hands through life
If there is a sign that says 'warning, you might slip on this floor' and your like 'fuck that sign I'm gonna run'
and you slip, thats on you and it freaks me out that there are stories in this country
where its like, there is a kid and he goes over his friends house
parent says its ok, they are on a trampoline, the kid breaks an arm
lawsuit, how? You sent your kid over here,
You knew the situation, or if you didn't be a fucking parent, maybe?
Or to an even greater level, I was having conversation, well more of a debate with someone recently
They were trying to argue the point that a child molester is actually a victim of there own brain
My response to that was, well respectfully, fuck you, no.
you can argue that someones brain might be wired a different way
but if you act on something, you made a choice
you did something and you are personally responsible for it
you don't get to play a card like' ahh my brain though'
people need to be held accountable. On the potential police story, Savsparkles writes:
'If the police report is true and she tried to attack them first ( which I don't quite know if I trust)
then why can't these two grown men take down a 120 Lbs girl?
Why do you need to use a dog on someone who wasn't even committing a crime?
Police need to be trained that they don't need to use that amount of force on someone who is defenceless
I really don't see why the amount of force was needed at all'
well if I was to play devils advocate, my argument would be based off of everything we have heard thus far
the police officers involver, if they were telling the truth, were not the brightest bulbs
They were looking for a 30 year old, 160 pound, 5,10  black man
Shaved head, goatee and then they stopped her
This 5,2, 19 year old girl and they were like 'thats him!'
Then maybe when one of the officers already had the backpack
he went to grab her hand to 'gain control'
she was on the bike, maybe whilst stepping over, there was an awkward fall
They escalate rather than deescalate the situation because its definitely him!
This guy who is definitely not a 5,2, 120 pound female
is going to grab a machete and kill me, so I am going to punch her in the face and stick a dog on her
from everything that has came out about this story, its just so hard for me to believe the cops here
and thats actually where I am going to end todays show
I want to thank all of you beautiful bastards for another fantastic week
whether you just watch, you comment, you like, you share, you are part of DeFranco Elite and you help fund what we are doing
thank you, thank you a million times thank you
I really couldn't do what we do the way we do it without you,
sure as hell wouldn't be able to build what we are building now without you
so thank you and of course as always, my name is Philip DeFranco
you have just been filled in, I love yo' faces and I will see you Monday
